bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Edward R. Stitt, December 19, 1946

div1.p: Hench sends Stitt photographs of the recent Walter Reed Memorial Association board meeting. He thanks Stitt for information on Carter and requests the address of Carter's daughter.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Edward R. Stitt, December 19, 1946
div1.opener:
December 19, 1946
Admiral E. R. Stitt
1625 R Street, North West
Washington 9, D. C.
My dear Admiral Stitt:
div1.p:
By separate post I am sending you some
small enlargements of the snapshots I took at our
recent meeting. These were taken with a $5 “flash”
Brownie so please don't compare them with pro-
fessionals. I am sending copies to each of the
men in the photograph and also to the Reed family.
Should you wish more, please let me know.

I appreciated so much the interesting
information that you gave me about Doctor Carter.
You may remember that you gave me the address of
your wife's sister who may have some records of
the family. I scribbled this address on an envelope
while standing with you in the bank--for the life
of me I can not find the address and would appre-
ciate it greatly if you would send the name and
address of Doctor Carter's daughter. Would you
also remind me of what date she might have. I
believe you mentioned possibly some correspondence
between Doctor Carter and Walter Reed.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alp
